description: Descriptions of lesser known series types. The relevant description is added to the screen reader information region when these series types are used.

children.name: arearange
children.default: Arearange charts are line charts displaying a range between a lower and higher value for each point.

children.name: areasplinerange
children.default: These charts are line charts displaying a range between a lower and higher value for each point.

children.name: boxplot
children.default: Box plot charts are typically used to display groups of statistical data. Each data point in the chart can have up to 5 values: minimum, lower quartile, median, upper quartile, and maximum.

children.name: bubble
children.default: Bubble charts are scatter charts where each data point also has a size value.

children.name: columnrange
children.default: Columnrange charts are column charts displaying a range between a lower and higher value for each point.

children.name: errorbar
children.default: Errorbar series are used to display the variability of the data.

children.name: funnel
children.default: Funnel charts are used to display reduction of data in stages.

children.name: pyramid
children.default: Pyramid charts consist of a single pyramid with item heights corresponding to each point value.

children.name: waterfall
children.default: A waterfall chart is a column chart where each column contributes towards a total end value.
